page.title: 19The Cock,Great Thurlow
page.content: The Cock public house in Thurlow was built in 1614 and has always been a pub.It was refronted in the 18th century and modernised in the 20th century.It is two storeys high and has a five -windowed range. The Cock is said to have a ghost! -John Savage-who died there in unfortunate circumstances.Sometimes the customers hear doors bang or see them opening for no apparent reason. The pub is owned by the Atherton family who have a marvellous display of horse-brasses on show. During the week,customers are usually people who live in the village,but at the weekendsit attracts people from nearby towns and tourists. Some of the customers play in the darts team,which is part of a local league.
